items.message:
Property flooding is not currently expected.
River levels have fallen, but are forecast to rise on the River Wey as a result of heavy rainfall. 
Further rainfall is forecast in the early hours of the morning 21/06/21. 
We are closely monitoring the situation.
Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings and refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. 
This message will be updated tomorrow 21/06/21, or as the situation changes.

Property flooding is not currently expected.
River levels are high but steady on the River Thame following a period of sustained rainfall. Levels on the Chalgrove Brook are below the flood risk threshold. Therefore, flooding of low-lying land, footpaths and roads is expected to continue, especially in the Thame area. 
Some further rainfall is forecast over the next 12 hours, but totals are forecast to be low. We expect river levels to begin falling at Thame from later today 20/06/21.
We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff are in the area carrying out checks in key areas which may pose a flood risk. 
Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings, and refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. 
This message will be updated tomorrow, 21/06/21, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Blackwater and The Cove Brook
items.message:
Property flooding is not currently expected.

Further rainfall is forecast in the early hours of tomorrow morning, 21/06/21. 
We are closely monitoring the situation.
Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings and refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. 
This message will be updated tomorrow 21/06/21, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Kennet and its tributaries from Berwick Bassett down to Newbury

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Kennet, River Og, River Aldbourne, Froxfield Stream, River Dun, River Shalbourne

items.message:
Property flooding is not currently expected.
River levels are high but steady on the River Kennet following a period of sustained rainfall. Therefore, the risk of flooding remains, especially in areas around Hungerford. 
Some further rainfall is forecast over the next 24 hours, with the heaviest showers forecast from tomorrow morning 21/06/21. We expect river levels to begin falling from later today 20/06/21, but rivers will remain sensitive to further rainfall.
We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff are in the area carrying out checks in key areas which may pose a flood risk. 
Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings, and refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. 
This message will be updated tomorrow, 21/06/21, or as the situation changes.

Property flooding is not currently expected.
River levels are forecast to rise on the River Loddon as a result of heavy rainfall. 
Further rainfall is forecast in the early hours of tomorrow morning 21/06/21. 
We are closely monitoring the situation. 
Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings and refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. 
This message will be updated tomorrow 21/06/21, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Pang from East Ilsley to Pangbourne and Sulham Brook
items.message:
This Flood Alert has been removed. 
River levels on the Sulham Brook and River Pang have now fallen below the flood risk threshold. There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. Further rainfall is forecast today 20/06/21, but the rivers are not forecast to reach the flood risk threshold. 
We continue to monitor the situation. We are carrying out checks in key areas which may pose a flood risk, and will re-issue this alert if necessary.
Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings, and refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels.

Property flooding is not currently expected.
River levels have fallen, but could rise again on the River Cut as a result of rainfall. 
Further rainfall is forecast in the early hours of the morning, 21/06/21. 
We are closely monitoring the situation. 
Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings and refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. 
This message will be updated tomorrow 21/06/21, or as the situation changes.

The risk of flooding from the Harpers Brook and Willow Brook has now reduced and levels have fallen below levels of concern. No further flooding to fields and roads is expected, however there may be standing water seen for several days.

This Flood Alert has been removed. 
River levels have now fallen below the flood risk threshold. We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert/warning if necessary. Further rainfall is forecast in the early hours of the morning, but is not expected to increase the river levels significantly. 
We continue to monitor the situation. 
Please refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels.

items.description: Middle River Great Ouse in Milton Keynes, Bedford Borough and Central Bedfordshire
items.message:
This Flood Alert has been removed.
River levels have now fallen below the flood risk threshold. Further light rainfall is forecast over the next 24 hours.  
We continue to monitor the situation.

items.description: River Loddon and River Blackwater at Swallowfield
items.message:
Property flooding could still be a possibility for properties closest to the river.
River levels are forecast to rise on the River Loddon and Blackwater as a result of heavy rainfall. 
Further rainfall is forecast in the early hours of tomorrow morning 21/06/21. 
We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff have been in the area today checking water levels.  
Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings and refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. 
This message will be updated tomorrow morning, 21/06/21, or as the situation changes.

Property flooding is not currently expected.
